data.title: Latrobe Valley Funeral Services Pty Ltd
data.meta_description: The funeral service for Vincent Pulis to be held in Morwell will be on 08 Apr 2022, 12:00 am. Please see details on the Latrobe Valley funeral website.
data.text:
President, Committee and Members of The Maltese Community Centre Latrobe Valley, are saddened by the passing away of Vince , past President for a number of years.

Condolences to Maria and all the Family at this very sad time.

Mario Sammut OAM.

Mario Sammut

Our deepest condolences to the Pulis family on the passing of Mr Pulis, a true gentleman.

Jason & Trish Till and Max & Mary Palmer

Trish

Rest in Peace Vince condolences to Maria and family. Kathleen and Charlie.

Kathleen Bajada

Carmen, Julian, Jason and family,

Sending our heartfelt condolences to you all at this sad time.

Thinking of you,

Kevin, Donna and Jared xo

Donna Baldacchino

Condolences to you all, Vince was a true gentleman and will be missed by all who knew him.

Kerri Georgiou

Vince (Father in-law)

Thank you for welcoming me into your family with loving arms.

I wish I got to spend more time with you and even though I have known you since I was a little girl, I am very happy to have gotten to know you better in this last 15 months.

You are now in heaven with my dad (Joe Mallia) and hopefully are both sitting back together watching over us.

We will always love you and will never forget you.

Thank you for calling me your daughter, that was a privilege, that I will take with me always.

Love your daughter in-law Liz xx

Liz Mallia-Pulis

Dad, it’s hard to believe it’s been a week since you left this world and still feels like a bad dream. I wish I could sit and talk to you one more time and give you a kiss and a hug and tell you I love you. Our fishing trips and your jokes will be sadly missed. Not only have I lost my Dad but I have also lost my friend who helped me through life and guided me. Most of all I miss you. Love you Dad. You are gone but never forgotten. Rest in peace mate.

Joe Pulis

My condolences to Joe and family for your sad loss your dad always had a hello whenever we met in the street or at the market a true gentleman will be sadly missed.

Wayne Knibbs

wayne and Sue Knibbs
